channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: My wife and I passed on a family wedding due to a ‘no-child’ rule. We’re now attending a friend’s nuptials without our kids. Are we hypocrites?
item.description: “My in-laws are coming to watch our 7-year-old daughter and her 2-year-old sister.”

item.title: ‘We’ve had two cars for 40 years’: With congestion charges, insurance and gas prices — should we sell our second car? Or will we regret it?
item.description: “I’m semi-retired working about 20 hours a month at my own business.”

item.title: Oil futures move up to trade higher for the week
item.description: Oil futures edged higher on Thursday, with U.S. and global benchmark prices turning higher for the week after posting losses day earlier, when weekly ...

item.title: Micron’s stock leads the S&P 500 for 2025. Here’s why more gains could follow.
item.description: An analyst sees big upside ahead, fueled by rapid growth in high-bandwidth memory for AI.

item.title: U.K. Pound, Bonds Slide; U.S. Stock Market Closed
item.description: Volatility in U.K. asset prices evokes memories of the 2022 market meltdown.

item.title: U.K. Bond Yields Hit Highs Not Seen Since 1998
item.description: Yields on U.K. government debt rose to their highest levels for over 25 years and the British pound continued to sag against the dollar, as investors ...

item.title: U.S. Natural Gas Futures Add to Gains
item.description: Natural gas futures were higher with continuing support from weather-driven demand across much of the U.S. and high LNG feedgas flows to export facili...

item.title: UBS Close to Large Settlement Over Credit Suisse Tax Case
item.description: The potential payout relates to an earlier deal over tax evasion by U.S. clients of Credit Suisse, the rival Swiss bank that UBS acquired in 2023.

item.title: Sterling's Fall Unlikely to be Sustained

item.title: Medicare can cover Zepbound for sleep apnea, creating a significant opportunity for Eli Lilly
item.description: Zepbound is not covered by Medicare or many other insurance plans as a treatment for weight loss. The injectable treatment costs about $1,000 a month ...
